name: Ennai Kathirikai
history: Ennai Kathirikai is a traditional South Indian dish originating from Tamil Nadu. It's a popular curry made with small brinjals, commonly known as eggplants, which are stuffed with a spicy mixture and simmered in tamarind gravy.
description: Ennai Kathirikai is a flavorful brinjal (eggplant) curry where the brinjals are slit and stuffed with a spicy masala, then cooked in a tangy tamarind sauce. This dish is famous for its distinct flavors and is often served with rice.

instructions.title: Prepare the Brinjals
instructions.description: Slit the brinjals into four without cutting through the stem. Soak in water to prevent discoloration.

instructions.title: Make Stuffing Masala
instructions.description: Mix sambar powder, turmeric, and salt. Stuff this mixture into the slit brinjals.

instructions.title: Prepare Tamarind Water
instructions.description: Mix tamarind paste in water to make tamarind water.

instructions.title: Cook the Brinjals
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, fenugreek seeds, dry red chilies, asafoetida, and curry leaves. Add the stuffed brinjals and saut√© gently.

instructions.title: Add Tamarind Water and Simmer
instructions.description: Add tamarind water to the pan. Cover and simmer until the brinjals are cooked and the gravy thickens.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Ennai Kathirikai hot with rice or roti.

tips: Ensure the brinjals are fresh and tender for the best taste.
Adjust the amount of tamarind and sambar powder according to your taste.
variations: Add a pinch of jaggery to balance the tanginess of the tamarind.
You can also use small onions or garlic for additional flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat gently on the stove over medium heat until warm.

presentationTips: Garnish with coriander leaves for a pop of color.
Serve in a traditional clay bowl for an authentic presentation.
